description: Attempting to access a method or property on a null object reference. This is the most common crash in Android development.
commonCauses: Accessing findViewById result before checking if it's null
Calling methods on nullable variables without null check
Intent extras retrieved without checking for null
Recycler ViewHolder accessing views after recycling
solutions: Use lateinit carefully - ensure initialization before access
Validate Intent extras with getStringExtra() ?: default
In Fragments, use viewLifecycleOwner for view observations
Use Elvis operator for safe defaults: value ?: defaultValue
prevention: Enable strict null checks in Kotlin
Initialize variables at declaration when possible
Validate all external data (Intent, Bundle, Network)
Use sealed classes for state management
Add null assertions only when 100% certain
